meanings.definition: A pictorial symbol or sign representing an object or concept.
meanings.sent1: The cave drawings were a pictograph of ancient life.
meanings.sent2: The hieroglyphics were a form of pictograph used by the Egyptians.
meanings.sent3: The children made a pictograph of their favorite animals using colored markers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a pictograph of happiness, easy to understand and bright.
meanings.sent5: The map used a pictograph to show where the treasure was buried.

meanings.definition: A form of writing using pictures or symbols instead of words.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization used pictographs to communicate.
meanings.sent2: The emoji on the phone screen is a modern form of pictograph.
meanings.sent3: The recipe book had a pictograph of a chef hat to indicate cooking instructions.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like pictographs, revealing his emotions without words.
meanings.sent5: The street signs used pictographs to guide the travelers.
